meanings.definition: A building in which a state legislature meets.
meanings.sent1: The statehouses in our city are where important laws are made.
meanings.sent2: I visited the statehouses in the capital to learn about the legislative process.
meanings.sent3: The statehouses decided to have a dance-off instead of a debate.
meanings.sent4: The statehouses stood tall like guardians of democracy.
meanings.sent5: The grand statehouses gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of state power.

meanings.definition: The governing body of a state.
meanings.sent1: Members of the statehouses work together to create new policies.
meanings.sent2: The statehouses passed a bill to improve education in the state.
meanings.sent3: The statehouses held a pizza-eating contest to determine the next law.
meanings.sent4: The statehouses were like a hive of busy bees, buzzing with activity.
meanings.sent5: The statehouses echoed with the voices of lawmakers, shaping the future of the state.
